meanings.definition: A noisy or violent disturbance; a commotion.
meanings.sent1: The children's rumpuses could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: The rumpuses in the street made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: The rumpuses at the party were so loud that even the neighbors complained.
meanings.sent4: The rumpuses of the thunderstorm shook the entire house.
meanings.sent5: The rumpuses of the city nightlife kept many people awake at night.

meanings.definition: To make a noisy disturbance; to cause a commotion.
meanings.sent1: Please don't rumpuses in the library, it's a quiet place.
meanings.sent2: The students rumpuses in the classroom disrupted the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The dog rumpuses around the house whenever someone comes to visit.
meanings.sent4: The wind rumpuses through the trees, making them sway wildly.
meanings.sent5: The children rumpuses in the playground, laughing and playing together.
